metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16869 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Netty before 4.1.42.Final mishandles whitespace before the colon in HTTP headers (such as a "Transfer-Encoding : chunked" line), which leads to HTTP request smuggling. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-16869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.33-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.33-3').
